unit.comment: /* * Active memory defragmentation * Try to find key / value allocations that need to be re-allocated in order * to reduce external fragmentation. * We do that by scanning the keyspace and for each pointer we have, we can try to * ask the allocator if moving it to a new address will help reduce fragmentation. * * Copyright (c) 2017, Oran Agra * Copyright (c) 2017, Redis Labs, Inc * All rights reserved. * * Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without * modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met: * * * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, * this list of conditions and the following disclaimer. * * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright * notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the * documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution. * * Neither the name of Redis nor the names of its contributors may be used * to endorse or promote products derived from this software without * specific prior written permission. * * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" * AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE * IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE * ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT OWNER OR CONTRIBUTORS BE * LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR * CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF * SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS * INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN * CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) * ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE * POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. */
/* this method was added to jemalloc in order to help us understand which * pointers are worthwhile moving and which aren't */
/* forward declarations*/
unit.function_decl: dictEntry* replaceSateliteDictKeyPtrAndOrDefragDictEntry(dict *d, sds oldkey, sds newkey, uint64_t hash, PORT_LONG *defragged);
unit.comment: /* Defrag helper for generic allocations. * * returns NULL in case the allocatoin wasn't moved. * when it returns a non-null value, the old pointer was already released * and should NOT be accessed. */

function.name: activeDefragAlloc

unit.comment: /*Defrag helper for sds strings * * returns NULL in case the allocatoin wasn't moved. * when it returns a non-null value, the old pointer was already released * and should NOT be accessed. */

function.name: activeDefragSds

unit.comment: /* Defrag helper for robj and/or string objects * * returns NULL in case the allocatoin wasn't moved. * when it returns a non-null value, the old pointer was already released * and should NOT be accessed. */

function.name: activeDefragStringOb

unit.comment: /* Defrag helper for dictEntries to be used during dict iteration (called on * each step). Teturns a stat of how many pointers were moved. */

function.name: dictIterDefragEntry
dictDefragTables

unit.comment: /* Internal function used by zslDefrag */

function.name: zslUpdateNode

unit.comment: /* Defrag helper for sorted set. * Update the robj pointer, defrag the skiplist struct and return the new score * reference. We may not access oldele pointer (not even the pointer stored in * the skiplist), as it was already freed. Newele may be null, in which case we * only need to defrag the skiplist, but not update the obj pointer. * When return value is non-NULL, it is the score reference that must be updated * in the dict record. */

function.name: zslDefrag
function.parameter_list: (zskiplist *zsl, double score, sds oldele, sds newele)

unit.comment: /* Defrag helpler for sorted set. * Defrag a single dict entry key name, and corresponding skiplist struct */

function.name: activeDefragZsetEntry

unit.comment: /* Defrag a dict with sds key and optional value (either ptr, sds or robj string) */

function.name: activeDefragSdsDict

unit.comment: /* Defrag a list of ptr, sds or robj string values */

function.name: activeDefragList

unit.comment: /* Defrag a list of sds values and a dict with the same sds keys */

function.name: activeDefragSdsListAndDict

unit.comment: /* Utility function that replaces an old key pointer in the dictionary with a * new pointer. Additionally, we try to defrag the dictEntry in that dict. * Oldkey mey be a dead pointer and should not be accessed (we get a * pre-calculated hash value). Newkey may be null if the key pointer wasn't * moved. Return value is the the dictEntry if found, or NULL if not found. * NOTE: this is very ugly code, but it let's us avoid the complication of * doing a scan on another dict. */

function.name: replaceSateliteDictKeyPtrAndOrDefragDictEntry
function.parameter_list: (dict *d, sds oldkey, sds newkey, uint64_t hash, PORT_LONG *defragged)

function.name: activeDefragQuickListNodes
defragLater
scanLaterList
scanLaterZsetCallback
scanLaterZset
scanLaterSetCallback
scanLaterSet
scanLaterHashCallback
scanLaterHash
defragQuicklist
defragZsetSkiplist
defragHash
defragSet

unit.comment: /* Defrag callback for radix tree iterator, called for each node, * used in order to defrag the nodes allocations. */

function.name: defragRaxNode

unit.comment: /* returns 0 if no more work needs to be been done, and 1 if time is up and more work is needed. */

function.name: scanLaterStraemListpacks

unit.comment: /* optional callback used defrag each rax element (not including the element pointer itself) */

/* defrag radix tree including: * 1) rax struct * 2) rax nodes * 3) rax entry data (only if defrag_data is specified) * 4) call a callback per element, and allow the callback to return a new pointer for the element */

function.name: defragRadixTree
defragStreamConsumerPendingEntry
defragStreamConsumer
defragStreamConsumerGroup
defragStream
defragKey

unit.comment: /* Defrag scan callback for the main db dictionary. */

function.name: defragScanCallback

unit.comment: /* Defrag scan callback for each hash table bicket, * used in order to defrag the dictEntry allocations. */

function.name: defragDictBucketCallback

unit.comment: /* Utility function to get the fragmentation ratio from jemalloc. * It is critical to do that by comparing only heap maps that belong to * jemalloc, and skip ones the jemalloc keeps as spare. Since we use this * fragmentation ratio in order to decide if a defrag action should be taken * or not, a false detection can cause the defragmenter to waste a lot of CPU * without the possibility of getting any results. */

function.name: getAllocatorFragmentation

unit.comment: /* We may need to defrag other globals, one small allcation can hold a full allocator run. * so although small, it is still important to defrag these */

function.name: defragOtherGlobals

unit.comment: /* returns 0 more work may or may not be needed (see non-zero cursor), * and 1 if time is up and more work is needed. */

function.name: defragLaterItem

unit.comment: /* returns 0 if no more work needs to be been done, and 1 if time is up and more work is needed. */

function.name: defragLaterStep

unit.comment: /* decide if defrag is needed, and at what CPU effort to invest in it */

function.name: computeDefragCycles
activeDefragCycle

unit.comment: /* HAVE_DEFRAG */

function.name: activeDefragCycle
